channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Paris prosecutors raid X offices as part of investigation into child abuse images
item.description: The prosecutors raided the offices of X as part of a preliminary investigation into allegations including spreading child sexual abuse images and deep...

item.title: PepsiCo will cut prices on Lay's, Cheetos by as much as 15%
item.description: The food giant is among many big brands worried as shoppers pull back on snack budgets after years of stubborn inflation.

item.title: Takeaways from the latest Epstein files. And, police search for Savannah Guthrie's mom
item.description: NPR analyzes the latest Jeffrey Epstein files. And, Arizona authorities launched an urgent search for Savannah Guthrie's 84-year-old mother, Nancyafte...

item.title: Despite a 'ruptured' knee ligament, Lindsey Vonn says she will compete in the Olympics
item.description: The 41-year-old's remarkable comeback from retirement was thrown into jeopardy after she hurt her knee during a crash in competition last week. But th...

item.title: 5 papers from the Super Bowl of Economics
item.description: Planet Money went to the annual meeting of the American Economics Association, and we saw some fascinating papers presented there.

item.title: Trump says Republicans 'should take over the voting' and 'nationalise' US elections
item.description: American elections are primarily run by state law, and voting is administered by local officials across the country.

item.title: Blood found inside home of Savannah Guthrie's mother, source says

item.title: Thousands of Epstein documents taken down after victims identified
item.description: The US Department of Justice faces criticism from victims after names and unredacted images included in latest release.

item.title: House set to vote on funding package to end government shutdown
item.description: The House is set to vote on funding major parts of the government to end the partial shutdown. Follow live updates here.

item.title: Clintons agree to testify on Epstein as vote looms to hold them in contempt of Congress
item.description: The couple previously argued that a House committee's demands were invalid. It is not clear when they will testify.

item.title: What is the price of silver today: February 3, 2026?
item.description: The price of silver has noticeably changed in recent days. Here's where it sits as of February 3, 2026.

item.title: Son of Norway's crown princess hears details of rape charges in tense trial for royal family
item.description: Marius Borg Høiby is accused of 38 charges including four counts of rape in one of the biggest cases in Norway for years.

item.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX acquires xAI to form company worth $1.25 trillion
item.description: SpaceX acquired xAI to create a company valued at $1.25 trillion, SpaceX announced. Al Root, an associate editor at Barron's, joins with more.

item.title: Restored angel fresco resembling Italian PM Meloni sparks investigation
item.description: The artist has denied modelling the fresco on the prime minister.

item.title: Judge blocks Trump administration from ending protections for Haitians
Authorities believe ‘Today’ show host Savannah Guthrie’s mother was taken against her will
Trump’s $45 billion expansion of immigrant detention sites faces pushback from communities
item.description: State and local officials are pushing back against federal plans to expand immigrant detention facilities.
